description: CBS correspondent and author Jonathan Vigliotti joins The Takeout to discuss his new book "Before It's Gone," about how climate change is impacting small towns due to their lack of infrastructure and financial resources. He focuses on how communities rebuild after climate-related disasters and what lessons can be learned from their resilience.
title: 4/7: The Takeout: The Takeout's Major Garrett interviews Jonathan Vigliotti about the impact of climate change

description: The South Carolina Gamecocks won Sunday's NCAA women's championship game against the Iowa Hawkeyes.
title: South Carolina beats off challenge from Iowa and Catilin Clark to win NCAA women's championship

description: A Southwest Airlines flight returned to Denver International Airport on Sunday after an engine cowling fell off the Boeing plane during takeoff.
title: Engine part falls off Boeing plane, strikes wing flap during takeoff

description: Police arrested Shant Soghomonian for allegedly starting a fire at Sen. Bernie Sanders' Vermont office.
title: Man arrested after allegedly starting fire at Bernie Sanders' Vermont office

description: The governor said he's been "amazed" by the work so far, with channels having been opened up for some ships just in less than two weeks since the bridge's March 26 collapse.
title: Gov. Moore says "aggressive timeline" to reopen channel is realistic

description: Rachel Goldberg-Polin, whose 23-year-old son Hersh was taken hostage by Hamas, calls the amount of time that has passed a "failure on everybody's part."
title: Mother of hostage: "All the parties at the table have failed"

description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Maryland Gov. Wes Moore and National Security Council spokesperson John Kirby join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation," April 7, 2024

description: This week on "Face the Nation," six months to the day after Hamas attacked Israel, the Israeli military has pulled many of its troops out of southern Gaza. Holly Williams joins from Tel Aviv with more. Plus, Maryland Gov. Wes Moore and Sen. Chris Van Hollen join as Baltimore seeks to rebuild from the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
title: 4/7: Face the Nation

description: John Kirby said Israeli officials have told the White House that the reduced number of troops in Gaza is part of a "rest and refit" due to troops being on the ground for four months.
title: Israel told White House that IDF troops will have "rest and refit," Kirby says

description: The record-breaking sum that the Trump campaign reported raising far surpassed the amount brought in by a star-studded fundraiser for the Biden campaign last month.
title: Trump campaign says it raised $50.5 million at Florida fundraiser

description: Rachel Goldberg-Polin, whose 23-year-old son Hersh was taken hostage by Hamas, tells "Face the Nation" that the amount of time that the hostages are being held is "actually a complete failure on everybody's part." "All the parties at the table have failed to get these 133 souls back home," she added.
title: "All the parties at the table have failed" to free those held by Hamas, mother of hostage says

description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on... Maryland Gov. Wes Moore tells "Face the Nation" that there is a plan to reopen the channel for maritime operations by the end of May, Republican Rep. French Hill of Arkansas tells "Face the Nation" that House Speaker Mike Johnson is "committed" to bringing aid to Ukraine to the floor, and Rachel Goldberg-Polin, whose 23-year-old son Hersh was taken hostage by Hamas, tells "Face the Nation" that the amount of time that the hostages are being held is "actually a complete failure on everybody's part.
title: Face The Nation: Moore, Hill, Goldberg-Polin

description: Less than two weeks after the Francis Scott Key Bridge collapsed and the Port of Baltimore closed, Maryland Gov. Wes Moore tells "Face the Nation" that there is a plan to reopen the channel for maritime operations by the end of May. "It is an aggressive timeline, but we are going to work around the clock to make sure that we hit this timeline," Moore said.
title: Gov. Wes Moore says “aggressive timeline” to reopen channel after bridge collapse is realistic

description: With Congress set to return from break this week, Republican Rep. French Hill of Arkansas tells "Face the Nation" that House Speaker Mike Johnson is "committed" to bringing aid to Ukraine to the floor. "I think that's critical as it should have been passed months ago," Hill said.
title: GOP Rep. French Hill says Ukraine aid is "critical" and it should have "passed months ago"

description: Avril Benoit, Doctors Without Borders executive director, and Janti Soeripto, Save the Children president, join "Face the Nation" to discuss the war between Israel and Hamas. "What we have seen time and again for the last six months, is that Israel is conducting this war in a way that completely disregards the need to protect civilians at all costs," Benoit said.
title: Israel "disregards the need to protect civilians" in war, Doctors Without Borders chief says

description: Ahead of the 2024 solar eclipse, veterinarians explain what kinds of behaviors and reactions people might see in their animals.
title: Will the solar eclipse affect animals? Veterinarians share pet safety tips

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Maryland Gov. Wes Moore that aired on April 7, 2024.
title: Transcript: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore on "Face the Nation," April 7, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Avril Benoit, Doctors Without Borders executive director, and Janti Soeripto, Save the Children president, that aired on April 7, 2024.
title: Transcript: Avril Benoit, Doctors Without Borders executive director, and Janti Soeripto, Save the Children president, on "Face the Nation," April 7, 2024

description: The Israeli military said Sunday that it has only one division of troops left inside the Gaza Strip. An Israeli military spokesperson told Holly Williams that this is an "evolution" of the war effort and not a partial withdrawal.
title: Israeli military says it has only one division left inside Gaza

description: This week on "Face the Nation," six months to the day after Hamas attacked Israel, the Israeli military has pulled many of its troops out of southern Gaza. Holly Williams joins from Tel Aviv with more. Plus, Maryland Gov. Wes Moore and Sen. Chris Van Hollen join as Baltimore seeks to rebuild from the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," April 7, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Rep. French Hill, Republican of Arkansas, that aired on April 7, 2024.
title: Transcript: Rep. French Hill on "Face the Nation," April 7, 2024

description: Democratic Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland tells "Face the Nation" that "I'm not clear" on the White House's policy toward Israel amid the war with Hamas. "The President and the White House have yet to lay out what consequences they have and they want to impose," Van Hollen said.
title: Sen. Chris Van Hollen says "I'm not clear" on White House policy toward Israel

description: The moon will shroud parts of North America in darkness when the total solar eclipse happens Monday, April 8. Here's what causes the phenomenon and why.
title: Why do total solar eclipses happen? Learn what causes the celestial show

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Rachel Goldberg-Polin, whose son 23-year-old Hersh has been taken hostage by Hamas, that aired on April 7, 2024.
title: Transcript: Rachel Goldberg-Polin on "Face the Nation," April 7, 2024

description: White House National Security Council spokesman John Kirby tells "Face the Nation" that the Biden administration has been "very clear" with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his government that the U.S. does not support a ground invasion in Rafah. Kirby said Israeli officials have told the White House that the reduced number of troops in the southern Gaza city of Rafah is part of a "rest and refit" due to troops being on the ground for four months.
title: Israel has told White House that IDF troops will have "rest and refit," NSC's John Kirby says

description: Comedian and actor Kevin James sits down with Jim Axelrod to discuss his Amazon Prime special "Kevin James: Irregardless,” and the journey he has taken throughout his career. Then, David Costa visits the National Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C., to view an exhibit on artist Mark Rothko’s work. “Here Comes the Sun” is a closer look at some of the people, places and things we bring you every week on “CBS Sunday Morning.”
title: Here Comes the Sun: Kevin James and more

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sen. Chris Van Hollen, Democrat of Maryland, that aired on April 7, 2024.
title: Transcript: Sen. Chris Van Hollen on "Face the Nation," April 7, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Adm. John Kirby, White House National Security Council spokesperson, that aired on April 7, 2024.
title: Transcript: John Kirby, National Security Council spokesperson, on "Face the Nation," April 7, 2024

description: Can't find solar eclipse glasses? Here's how to make a pinhole camera viewer using a cereal box.
title: How to make pinhole cameras to watch the 2024 solar eclipse safely

description: We leave you this Sunday among prairie chickens doing their dance in South Dakota. Videographer: Kevin Kjergaard.
title: Nature: Prairie chickens in South Dakota

description: Correspondent Steve Hartman's son, George, has long been an astronomy buff, and thrilled at witnessing the solar eclipse in 2017. So, it's no surprise that he's anxious to see Monday's spectacle in its totality.
title: A young eclipse fan ready for a cosmic show

description: In many states, young people in foster care are not receiving their rightful survivor or disability benefits, because state agencies are applying for the benefits themselves without giving notice to the child or his or her relatives.
title: Foster children deprived of benefits: How a loophole affects the most vulnerable

description: In many states, young people in foster care who are entitled to survivor and disability benefits are having those benefits taken by state agencies that apply for the benefits themselves without giving notice to the child or his or her relatives. More than 25,000 children nationwide are affected by this practice. "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty talks with young people who were denied tens of thousands of dollars; and with experts and officials trying to correct a situation which, though not illegal, is depriving those in foster care of their rightful benefits.
title: How a loophole deprives foster children of benefits

description: It's a topic that for generations was just whispered about: the challenges for women undergoing "the change." But today more and more women are speaking openly about the symptoms of perimenopause and menopause, the treatments, and the lingering stigma. Correspondent Tracy Smith talks with experts about the pros and cons of hormone replacement therapy, and the difficulties of underfunded research in women's health. She also visits a gathering of women called Menopause Mondays; and talks with the producers of the show "Menopause: The Musical," which takes a lighthearted look at the challenges of the change, from hot flashes to weight gain.
title: Clearing up misconceptions about menopause

description:
"Sunday Morning" looks back at some landmarks in country music, from Victor and Okeh, to Beyoncé.

Don't miss the 23rd CMT Music Awards, Sunday, April 7 on CBS and Paramount+.
title: Country music milestones

description: The '70s Tony Award-winning musical "The Wiz," a soulful retelling of L. Frank Baum's "The Wonderful Wizard of Oz," is back on Broadway. Contributor Kelefa Sanneh talks with members of the cast (including Wayne Brady, who is stepping into the shoes of the Wiz), and with director Schele Williams and writer Amber Ruffin, who are revising the show for today's audience.
title: "The Wiz" eases on down to Broadway

description: Total solar eclipses, like the one expected on April 8, 2024, are rare. This list shows the history of the phenomenon in the United States.
title: See the list of notable total solar eclipses in the U.S. since 1778

description: The British explorer who sailed the uncharted Pacific Ocean in the 1700s, and who was killed in Hawaii, initiated a period of colonization that obscured the histories of Native Islanders, a legacy that is being reexamined today.
title: Captain James Cook and the controversial legacy of Western exploration

description: The British explorer Captain James Cook, who sailed the uncharted Pacific Ocean in the 1700s, created detailed maps of places he was the first European to visit, including New Zealand, Australia, the Cook Islands (which still bear his name), and the islands of Hawaii. But Cook's legacy – initiating a period of colonization that obscured the histories of Native Islanders – is being reexamined today. Correspondent Ben Tracy looks back on Cook's voyages and imperial ambitions with historian Hampton Sides, author of a new book, "The Wide Wide Sea." He also visits the Big Island of Hawaii, and talks with native islanders about efforts to teach the history of Pacific island cultures.
title: The controversial legacy of Captain James Cook

description: "Sunday Morning" remembers some of the notable figures who left us this week, including British writer Lynne Reid Banks, author of the classic children's book "The Indian in the Cupboard."
title: Passage: In memoriam

description: Writer-director Alex Garland, and stars Kirsten Dunst, Nick Offerman, Wagner Moura and Cailee Spaeny, discuss the hot-button film imagining our nation divided, in which rebel forces from breakaway states try to depose an autocratic president.
title: An America fighting itself in "Civil War": "It's a warning"

description: "Civil War," the latest film by writer-director Alex Garland ("Ex Machina"), imagines an America divided, in which rebel forces from breakaway states try to depose an autocratic president. Turner Classic Movies host Ben Mankiewicz talks with Garland about the hot-button film, told through the eyes of journalists covering a domestic war. Stars Kirsten Dunst, Nick Offerman, Wagner Moura and Caylee Spaeny also discuss what the movie says about a polarized America today, and whether the collapse of democracy could happen here.
title: "Civil War": Depicting an America at war with itself

description: A homely, hollowed-out husk of a cherry tree in Washington, D.C., is not the prettiest or the healthiest. Still, tourists and locals alike can't get enough of "Stumpy." Correspondent Faith Salie pays tribute to an underdog of a tree that one photographer calls "so ugly, it's beautiful."
title: Stumpy, the Washington, D.C. Tidal Basin's "celebri-tree"

description: It's a topic that for generations was just whispered about. But today women are speaking more openly about the symptoms of perimenopause and menopause; treatments; and overcoming the stigma associated with "the change."
title: Flash: Menopause is no longer stigmatized

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: April 7

description: Monday's total eclipse of the sun will be viewable across a swath of 13 states. Learn what happens during an eclipse, and about preparations in one Arkansas town that is expected to double in size due to eclipse tourism traffic.
title: What happens during a solar eclipse? Experts explain the awe-inspiring phenomena to expect on April 8

description: On Monday, April 8, a rare total eclipse of the sun will be viewable across a swath of 13 states. Correspondent David Pogue talks with amateur astronomer Ed Ting about what to expect during the minutes of totality; and with Cari White, chairman of the Eclipse Oversight Committee for Jonesboro, Arkansas, where the town is expecting to temporarily double in size due to eclipse tourism traffic.
title: 2024 Eclipse: What to expect, from the awe-inspiring to the "very strange"

description: When the last total solar eclipse cast darkness across the U.S. in 2017, people across the country were captivated by the show.
title: When was the last total solar eclipse in the U.S.? Revisiting 2017

description: Astronomy fans figuring out where and what time to see the April 8, 2024, total solar eclipse can check out maps showing the path of totality.
title: Solar eclipse maps show 2024 totality path, peak times across the U.S.

description: Track NASCAR this weekend with all the information you need to watch the Martinsville Cook Out 400.
title: How to watch today's Martinsville Cook Out 400 NASCAR race: Livestream options, more

description: Caitlin Clark's last college game is the NCAA tournament championship game. Find out how and when to watch the Iowa vs. South Carolina game today.
title: Caitlin Clark advances: How to watch today's Iowa vs. South Carolina women's NCAA championship game

description: The 2024 CMT Music Awards are tonight. Here's who's performing, details on how to watch and more.
title: CMT Music Awards celebrate country music tonight. Here's what to know.

description: A mother of five disappears. A look inside the conspiracy to kill her. "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reports.
title: The Conspiracy to Murder Jennifer Dulos

description: Israelis protest against Netanyahu's government amid fears of wider regional conflict; American among 3 crew members to land at International Space Station
title: 4/6: CBS Weekend News

description: A vigil in honor of the victims of the tragic key bridge incident was held Saturday, April 6 as ongoing salvage and recovery efforts continue.
title: Community vigil, mural honors victims of the Key Bridge incident

description: Led by Castle and Clingan, UConn kept its bid to repeat as national champion intact by surviving its first true test of the NCAA Tournament.
title: Defending champ UConn returns to NCAA title game, beating Alabama 86-72

description: The case against Michelle Troconis, who was found guilty of conspiracy to commit murder in the death of Connecticut mom Jennifer Dulos, and her family's unwavering belief in her innocence.
title: Was woman convicted of murder conspiracy "fooled" by boyfriend?

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and Chinese Premier Li Qiang sounded a hopeful note on bilateral relations at the start of their Sunday meeting in Beijing.
title: Secretary Yellen meets with Chinese Premier Li in Beijing

description: The latest weight loss trend making the rounds on social media is a drink called "Oatzempic" — a play on the diabetes drug Ozempic. While some TikTok users claim the concoction can help people shed dramatic amounts of weight, health experts say it's not a sustainable or safe weight loss method.
title: Experts weigh in on "Oatzempic," the latest weight loss trend on social media.

description: Nearly 40 Democratic members of Congress, including former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, have signed a letter urging the Biden administration to reconsider a new arms package to Israel as civilian casualties mount in Gaza. Natalie Brand reports.
title: Democratic members of Congress urge Biden administration to reconsider new Israel arms package

description: Dr. Mohammad Subeh, an American doctor from California, reflected on his five weeks in Gaza treating hundreds of horrifically wounded children amid so few medical resources that he had to repeatedly donate his own blood. Imtiaz Tyab has the interview.
title: U.S. doctor on treating hundreds of children horrifically wounded by Israeli airstrikes in Gaza

description: Americans were forecast to legally wager nearly $3 billion during this year’s NCAA March Madness. Elise Preston reports on the business of sports betting amid the men’s Final Four basketball games.
title: Americans legally bet nearly $3 billion during 2024 NCAA March Madness

description: People across Israel protested against Prime Minister Netanyahu’s government Saturday, demanding that the roughly 130 remaining hostages be brought back from Gaza. The protests took place amid fears of a wider regional conflict after Israel killed seven members of Iran’s Revolutionary Guards in an airstrike. Holly Williams has the latest.
title: Israelis protest against Netanyahu's government amid fears of wider regional conflict

description: After 40 consecutive drawings produced no Powerball jackpot winner, Saturday's jackpot grew to an estimated $1.3 billion.
title: Powerball jackpot climbs to $1.3 billion

description: New York City officials faced criticism for their response to Friday’s earthquake, which was one of the biggest ever to hit the Northeast. Aftershocks continued on Saturday in parts of New Jersey and New York. Michael George reports.
title: NYC officials face criticism for earthquake response

description: Tennessee-based American Paper Optics, the nation’s largest producer of eclipse glasses, faces astronomical demand as tens of millions of Americans plan to watch Monday’s solar eclipse. Janet Shamlian reports from the Memphis-area plant.
title: Solar eclipse glasses makers face surging demand ahead of Monday's solar eclipse

description: Purdue kept its March Madness dream alive while snuffing out North Carolina State, getting 20 points and 12 rebounds from Zach Edey in a 63-50 victory.
title: Purdue beats N.C. State, powering into NCAA March Madness title game

description: A Russian Soyuz capsule carrying three crew members, including one American astronaut, landed at the International Space Station on Saturday.
title: American among 3 crew members to land at International Space Station

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with Major Garrett.
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Saturday, April 6, 2024
